page.title: 12ST.MICHEAL'S PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The size of the church is fairly large. It was built in 1853. The material they used to built it was stone. The windows are arch shaped and are also stained glass. In the nave there are thirty pews; in the chancel there are 4 seats and two spare. The altar is rectangular shaped and has some items such as candle sticks and a cross.The vicar reads from a Bible in the pulpit.The Bible was on the lectern. The furniture is made of wood and is very hard and there is a bench on the floor to kneel on.The altar is made of wood and the font is made from stone. Outside the church you can see heads of bishops and there is a grave of the first vicar whose name was David Jones. By the door there is a foot scraper. This is for scraping your feet before you enter.
